title: Clingy planets can trigger own doom, suspect Cheops and TESS
summary: Astronomers using the European Space Agency’s Cheops mission have caught an exoplanet that seems to be triggering flares of radiation from the star it orbits. These tremendous explosions are blasting away the planet’s wispy atmosphere, causing it to shrink every year.

title: 3 Years of Science: 10 Cosmic Surprises from NASA’s Webb Telescope
summary: Since July 2022, NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope has been unwaveringly focused on our universe. With its unprecedented power to detect and analyze otherwise invisible infrared light, Webb is making observations that were once impossible, changing our view of the cosmos from the most distant galaxies to our own solar system. Webb was built with […]

title: ArianeGroup Completes Key Prometheus Rocket Engine Tests
summary:
European rocket builder ArianeGroup has announced that it completed a series of Prometheus rocket engine test ignitions on 20 June, marking a key milestone in the programme. Developed under a European Space Agency contract, Prometheus is a reusable rocket engine capable of producing around 100 tonnes of thrust. It is designed to be manufactured at […]

summary:

title: NASA Stennis Engineer Takes Pride in Test Support Work

title: Astronomers may have found a third interstellar object
summary: The object has a very high eccentricity.

title: This is not the time to cut space-enabled medical research
summary:
Research that leverages space to develop treatments for blindness, cancer, and Parkinson’s disease is jeopardized by the $6.1 billion NASA budget cuts recently announced for 2026 by President Trump. The cuts to the International Space Station (ISS), forecasted to be $508 million, halt space research and development momentum, discourage investors, impede growth of the space […]

title: Space Force to fund development of Atomic-6 solar power for satellites
summary:
WASHINGTON — Composite materials startup Atomic-6 secured a $2 million agreement with the U.S. Space Force to mature its solar power array for military satellite applications, the company announced July 2. Based in Marietta, Georgia, Atomic-6 makes solar arrays that are designed to fold and unfold repeatedly, allowing spacecraft to reconfigure for different mission phases.  […]
The post Space Force to fund development of Atomic-6 solar power for satellites appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: MTG-S1 and Copernicus Sentinel-4 mission highlights
summary: Two meteorological missions – Meteosat Third Generation Sounder-1 (MTG-S1) and the Copernicus Sentinel-4 mission – have launched on board a SpaceX Falcon 9 from Cape Canaveral in Florida, US.

title: Boeing ships more O3b mPower satellites with fixes SES might no longer need
summary:
Boeing has shipped two more O3b mPower broadband satellites to SES with hardware fixes the operator might no longer need thanks to a surprising assist from solar storms. 
The post Boeing ships more O3b mPower satellites with fixes SES might no longer need appeared first on SpaceNews.
